perturbation.original_text: 1.3 The term “Cash Sales” shall mean the gross cash proceeds actually received by LEA or T&B from the sale of Products to persons responding to a Business-branded marketing campaign conducted by LEA that uses any or any combination of Licensed Intellectual Property. Cash Sales shall exclude any merchant fees, taxes, shipping, refunds (e.g., returns, right of rescission, NSF checks, and credit card chargebacks), rebates, and bad debt
perturbation.changed_text: 1.3 The term “Cash Sales” shall mean the gross cash proceeds actually received by LEA or T&B from the sale of Products to persons responding to a Business-branded marketing campaign conducted by LEA that uses any or any combination of Licensed Intellectual Property. Cash Sales will include any merchant fees, taxes, shipping, refunds (e.g., returns, right of rescission, NSF checks, and credit card chargebacks), rebates, and bad debt
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Cash Sales' excludes refunds, rebates, and bad debt from the gross cash proceeds. The modified definition includes these items. This creates an internal contradiction in how Cash Sales are calculated, impacting royalty payments and financial reporting obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 1.9. The term “Licensed Marks” The term “Licensed Marks” shall mean T&B’s current and future trademarks, service marks, and trade dress used in connection with the Business.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.9. The term “Licensed Marks” shall mean T&B’s current trademarks, service marks, and trade dress used in connection with the Business.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the word 'future' in the definition, LEA is only licensed to use T&B's current trademarks. However, Section 4.1 discusses the use of trademarks, creating uncertainty as to whether LEA can brand the business with any future trademarks of T&B that may become available during the term of the agreement.
